org.jsimpledb.core

Class NullSafeType<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jsimpledb.core.FieldType<T>
      • org.jsimpledb.core.NullSafeType<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparator<T>

    public class NullSafeType<T>
extends FieldType<T>
    A FieldType that wraps any other FieldType not supporting null values and adds support for null values by pre-pending to the binary encoding a 0x00 for non-null values or a 0xff byte for null values. Therefore, null values sort last.

    The default value becomes null and "null" is an accepted string value (therefore, "null" must not be a valid string value for the wrapped type).

    This class will automatically "inline" the 0xff for null values if the wrapped FieldType's FieldType.hasPrefix0xff() returns false.

      • hasPrefix0xff

        public boolean hasPrefix0xff()
        Description copied from class: FieldType
        Determine whether any of this field type's encoded values start with a 0xff byte. Certain optimizations are possible when this is not the case. It is safe for this method to always return true.

        The implementation in FieldType returns true.

        Overrides:
        hasPrefix0xff in class FieldType<T>

        The implementation in FieldType returns true.
